Reviews.Content: lovely hostel We stayed four nights, in a mixed dorm. The hostel is well run and clean. The staff friendly and helpful. The doors to the dorm don't lock, but there are lockers for each bed. The location is great -right down the street from the Piazza des spiritu sanctu where we found great restaurants every night. The piazza also featured a large Sunday market and there were a few market stalls everyday with interest things to look at. Down the street is a very helpful green grocer, a good bakery and a good cheese and cold cuts shop. We walked everywhere and went back to the hostel at the end of the afternoon before going out in the evening.
Reviews.Author: qcquebec

Reviews.Content: anywhere BUT HERE worst experience i've ever had at a hostel backpacking europe for 3 months!! if you like book camps w/ yelling nazis this is the place for you. they wake you up at 9:30AM, lock you out at 10:00AM and if you're still in bed they'll literally pull/throw you out (i made it 1/2 way across the room) and then kick you out w/o a refund. in addition they lock you out at 1:58AM, not the 2AM they advertise and then you have to sleep in the streets until they open up at 7 in the morn.avoid this place at all costs!!!
Reviews.Author: Mashimoto

Reviews.Content: Cheap and cheerful Cheap, easy access to florence town centre, just a 10 minute walk. Lovely friendly environment. Good facilities.
Reviews.Author: flubberdubdub

Reviews.Content: Liked staying here Stayed here for a few nights in Dec 2006. Was happy with my stay here - i met new friends, and have no significant complaints. I recommend this hostel!Positives:Clean rooms with comfortable bedsEfficient, english speaking staffLarge common room conducive to mingling with fellow travellersKitchen facilities (stove, sink, NO fridge as mentioned before... borrow utensils from front reception)Washing facilities (although 6.50euro for wash + dry)Negatives:Can be a bit of a trek from the train station if you have heavy bagsShowers - water pressure is not that high when the temperature is set to warm/hotNotes:Lock out btwn 10am and 2pmBYO towelTo take the bus - you need to go to the Piazza di santa Maria Novella (far end of the piazza)From the front of the exit (ie. turn left when you get off the train), turn right, cross the road (there is a round about here), walk to the left of Santa Maria Novella.Cross the piazza to the other side, where there will be a bus stop.Bus 36, 37 or 11 - 2nd stop after the bridge.
Reviews.Author: ozguytim

Reviews.Content: good basic accommodation I stayed here for 3 nights as a base for my visit to Florence. The location is central, close to the Arno in Oltrarno, so saved on transport.The good points are the hostel is very clean, with excellent showers, (for a hostel).There is a kitchen and equipment can be hired for free which keeps the budget down and there are cheap shops very near. However there is no fridge.The dorms are closed from 10 -2 but you can hang out in the living room, which by the way really needs a makeover.The negatives are, the dorm was rather cold, so a sleeping bag is recommended outside of Summer. The dorm I stayed in was large - 18 beds, so bring ear plugs and a sleeping mask to get a good night's sleep. I would definitely stay here again. What made it so good was the other backpackers were very friendly and I made some good friends while there. Hostelling is not about luxury, it is about the people you meet.
Reviews.Author: MartinBrit

Reviews.Content: Friendly staff I have just return from a short trip to Florence, Italy. Ostello Santa Monaca was the possible solution for me, as I booked my accomodation on the very last minute over their internet portal. With a good city map, the place is quite easy to find, at Oltrarno, across the river from the city center. Staff is very friendly and (a rarity in Italy) everyone here seemed to speak fluent english and spanish. The accomodation itself is obviously not a five-star hotel, but for the price and the location is surely a very good deal. The bed-dorms are rather small and there is no air-conditioning, the toilets and showers were not very easy to find but were clean. There is a possibility to use internet for a small fee and a big kitchen and dining room. It is a great place if you're wishing to meet another travellers and the location is superb: very close to all the main sites of the city center and just a few hundred meters away from Santa Maria Novella train station. There is a bus stop almost next to the hostel door if you feel too lazy to walk, a few mini-markets and cafeterias around for a simple breakfast are very easy to find (everything seemed to be opened on Sundays).
Reviews.Author: pjdsilva
